availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Wolford (Albany, New York, attorney, county judge, and Deputy Superintendent)

body.p: Albany, New York, clerk, attorney, county judge, and Deputy Superintendent. New York native. Married to Charlotte Wolford. Father of George B. Wolford. Clerk in Albany, New York, in 1850. Attorney in Albany, New York, in 1860. Partner at the law firm Wolford and Wade in Albany, New York, in 1861. County judge in Albany County, New York, in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, New York, Albany County, Albany Ward 9, p. 151A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, New York, Albany County, Albany Ward 4, p. 534.
The Albany Directory for the year 1861 (Albany: Adams, Sampson & Co., and Joel Munsell, 1861), 152.
The Albany Directory for the year 1862 (Albany: Adams, Sampson & Co., and Joel Munsell, 1862), 152.
The Albany Directory for the year 1863 (Albany: Adams, Sampson & Co., and Joel Munsell, 1863), 157.
The Albany Directory for the year 1864 (Albany: Adams, Sampson & Co., and Joel Munsell, 1864), 152.
The Albany Directory for the year 1865 (Albany: Adams, Sampson & Co., and Joel Munsell, 1865), 159.
Albany Rural Cemetery Internment Cards, Albany Rural Cemetery, Menands, New York.
